text: Scott Rudin (born July 14, 1958) is an American movie, television and theater producer. His movies produced include the Academy Award-winning Best Picture No Country for Old Men, as well as Lady Bird, Fences, The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo, The Social Network, School of Rock, Zoolander, The Truman Show, The First Wives Club, Clueless, The Addams Family, and eight Wes Anderson movies. On Broadway, he has won seventeen Tony Awards for shows such as The Book of Mormon, Hello, Dolly!, The Humans, A View from the Bridge, Fences, and Passion. In 2012, Rudin became one of the few people who have won an Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, and Tony Award, and the first producer to do so. ==References== Category:1958 births Category:Living people Category:Theatre producers Category:American television producers Category:Movie producers from New York City Category:Academy Award winning producers Category:Tony Award winners Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:Emmy Award winners
